page.title: 01COASTLINE TO NORTH OF LOFTUS
page.content: Block is dominated by high wastal cliffs in the southern third. At 550 ft. there are impression views east and west, and of the coastline and disused alum quarries. Hilly farmland inland from cliffs have no centres of population, just a few farms amd one country road. Popular with tourists for its scenery the area is accessible along several footpaths and importantly the Cleveland Way long distance footpath follows the cliffs which are lower in the west. Rocky intertidal area. The residents are seemingly all involved in farming and there are no amenities or tourist facilities other than roads and footpaths (and an interpretive board at the disused quarry) so the area is enjoyed by day trippers and walkers. Part of the area is in the North York Moors National Park.
